result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel Wilbur Albright was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Daniel Wilbur Albright is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Daniel Wilbur Albright was found guilty of Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

2:06 Defendant Daniel Wilbur Albright in court.  William Harold Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 14CF111 and 14CT59 heard at this time. Probation agent Sheila Drazkowski present in court. Ms Drawkowshi requests civil judgment on 14CF106 and 14CF11. Extend probation on 14CT59. Mr Albright addresses. Court waives civil judgments on 14CF106 and 14CF111 for court costs. Court will extend 14CT59 for 1 year or until paid in full. Court signs extension.

11:22  am    TO INCLUDE 14CT59 FOR SCHEDULING 
Defendant Daniel Wilbur Albright in court with attorney Joshua Hargrove.  Defendant Daniel Wilbur Albright in custody.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Investigator Colin Gilles sworn and examined by Wm Thorie.  Witness IDs the defendant.  Hargrove x-exams.  Thorie redirects.  Thorie makes argument.  Hargrove has no argument.  Court finds that there is probable cause to believe the crime has been committed and bound over for further proceeding.  Bond to continue in it's present form.  Hargrove indicates he will be filing sub judge on the two felony cases.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 15, 2014 at 10:00 am.
